sampleregistry

Class DatabaseAP

  • java.lang.Object
    • sampleregistry.DatabaseAP

  • public class DatabaseAP
extends java.lang.Object
    Database Layer - this class will contain all the database functionality to expose to the rest of the program. Two simple methods are written here to take advantage of the stored procedures in the database. One insert method to add new content and a reader method to collect all records entered into the database so far. Any new database functionality should go here.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatabaseAP() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> getRecords()
      getRecords calls the database stored procedure 'get_registrants' which is a wrapper for a select statement that orders by date entered (descending) The data is passed back in an ArrayList of String arrays for easy appending and traversal.
      boolean insertRecord(java.lang.String fname, java.lang.String lname, java.lang.String address1, java.lang.String address2, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String state, java.lang.String zip, java.lang.String country)
      insertRecord is a wrapper for the 'insert_registrant' stored proc.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getRecords

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> getRecords()
        getRecords calls the database stored procedure 'get_registrants' which is a wrapper for a select statement that orders by date entered (descending) The data is passed back in an ArrayList of String arrays for easy appending and traversal. This function should take page-size and start-index parameters for larger data sets.
        Returns:
        ArrayList>String[]<

      • insertRecord

        public boolean insertRecord(java.lang.String fname,
                            java.lang.String lname,
                            java.lang.String address1,
                            java.lang.String address2,
                            java.lang.String city,
                            java.lang.String state,
                            java.lang.String zip,
                            java.lang.String country)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        insertRecord is a wrapper for the 'insert_registrant' stored proc. Validation on parameters occurs in the servlet layer so as not to open the database connection unless all parameters have been validated.
        Parameters:
        fname - first name field
        lname - last name field
        address1 - address1 field
        address2 - address2 field
        city - city field
        state - two-letter state code
        zip - 5 or 9 digit zip code
        country - two-letter country code
        Returns:
        returns true if the entry has been inserted, false if not
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws an sql exception upon errors
